Description: The PRF Trust is officially transferred to ACS, allowing ACS to increase the value of existing research grant programs and explore developing new grant programs.
The Green Chemistry Institute, initially founded in 1997 as an independent nonprofit, officially becomes part of ACS.
ACS hosts the first Chemists Celebrate Earth Week.
ACS and Disney Institute work together to offer "Everyday Chemistry" at Epcot

The Award for Affordable Green Chemistry is established, recognizing the discovery of eco-friendly chemistries with the potential to enable products or manufacturing processes that are less expensive than existing alternatives.

ACS receives a gift of approximately $33 million from the Hach Scientific Foundation to continue the Foundation’s programs and complement pre-existing ACS resources. The ACS-Hach Programs continue to provide financial support to high school chemistry teachers across the U.S.
The first class of ACS Fellows is announced.
ACS renames their headquarters building in honor of Clifford and Kathryn Hach.
